name: Detail - Engineer to inspect all foundation surface inspections
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Across stripped area

Detail - This test shall be undertaken at the design subgrade level to a depth of 2-3m below the design subgrade level
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Average Minimum SU: > 60kPa

○ This test shall be undertaken at the design subgrade level to a depth of 2-3m below the design subgrade level
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum 3 blows per 100mm penetration

Detail - Engineer to inspect undercut surface and determine undercut requirements.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Granular Material: Scala 3 blows/100mm

Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - One test per 20m evenly spaced intervals along pipelines with a minimum of 1 test between each pit/manhole.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Subgrade CBR between 3.5% <5%: Undercut 150mm and Replace with Compacted AP65 or Approved Granular material.
○ Subgrade CBR between 2% <3.5%: Undercut 300mm and Replace with Compacted AP65 or Approved Granular material.
○ Subgrade CBR between <2%: Engineer to advise or Undercut 450mm and Replace with Compacted AP65 or Approved Granular material.
Standard / Specification - Table 1 Sheet STW 0405. PS- 21.6.11 AS/NZS 2566.2/2002
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - If Undercut required
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Average 95% MDD, min >92%
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - One test per 20m evenly spaced intervals along pipelines with a minimum of 1 test between each pit/manhole.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Vertical design Setout:

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Inspect pipes prior to backfilling to ensure they have been installed correctly and the joints are in place.
○ Check for gaps and/or defects and check pipe alignment for straightness

Detail - Settlement monitoring with installing the settlement plate at underpass foundation level and as described in PS 18.5.4 during the construction at various levels.

SECTION 4 – PRE-CONSTRUCTION - MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Detail - All Reinforcement bars and strands used in structural concrete to be approved by the engineer prior to construction.
○ Post tensioning strand to be high tension ASTM galvanized and complying with AS/NZ standard

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Test certificates shall be obtained from the manufacturer for all strand, cable and bar to be used in the work and copies shall be forwarded to the Engineer at least one week before the programmed commencement of any work incorporating these materials. Test certificates shall be traceable to the batch of material supplied to the work.
○ High yield steel, Grade 500E, Seismic MA.
○ Post tensioning strand to be high tension ASTM galvanized and complying with AS/NZ standard
Verifying Document - Supplier data sheet/ Mill certs
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Reinforcement cover spacer blocks shall be either made from concrete with a specified strength at least 10mPa stronger than the surrounding concrete; or Plastic spacer blocks.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Concrete cover spacing blocks = at least 10mPa stronger than surrounding concrete.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Approved mix design - Concrete shall be of the class as defined by NZS 3104 have a minimum 28 days compression strength as specified for various members: for underpass apron pour: 40mpa
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 28 Day concrete requirements: UNDERPASS APRON POUR: 40MPA
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Shop drawing review and approval from Engineer and Production QA Records to be submitted

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Send shop drawings to the Engineer for review, at least 14 days prior to manufacture. Any variations between the Drawings and shop drawings shall be clearly identified and brought to the attention of the Engineer.
Verifying Document - Shop Drawing Approval, QA records
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction

Detail - Permanent (not sacrificial) anti-graffiti coatings shall be applied to the exposed faces of all concrete surfaces including wingwalls. The coatings shall have a design life of not less than 10 years. The Contractor shall submit the proposed extent of application for authorisation by the Engineer.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Permanent (not sacrificial) anti-graffiti coatings shall be applied to the exposed faces of all concrete surfaces including wingwalls. The coatings shall have a design life of not less than 10 years. The Contractor shall submit the proposed extent of application for authorisation by the Engineer.
Verifying Document - Details of pre qualified product
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Application - Engineers Approval
Detail - Pre approved joint sealant meeting the specification requirements

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Joints are to be sealed using a fuel resistant, multi-component polysulphide sealant designed for horizontal and vertical joints in concrete and is joint sealant pourable or gunning grade as appropriate.
Verifying Document - Delivery dockets and supplier data sheet
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction - Engineers approval
Detail - Compressible filler board specification to meet the project requirements.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Details of the compressible filler board proposed to be used as a construction joint shall meet specification requirements.
Verifying Document - Delivery dockets and supplier data sheet
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
4.1.8 - Application of Non-Slip Coating - Sikafloor 91 or Sikafloor150
Detail - Proposed product to be approved by Engineer

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The top of the underpass floor slab and bottom chamfers will have Sikafloor 91 or Sikafloor 150 applied after the installation of the box culvert segments. The thickness of this is to be between 3 and 5mm. The application of the product must be done in accordance with the manufacturer’s specifications.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
SECTION 5 – CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES - BLINDING AND PRE-CAST POUR
5.1.1 - Setting out of Underpass Blinding level with 1% fall towards Northern end
Detail - Setting out boxing and complete site checks as concrete is poured to ensure flat surface for placing precast units
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Site supervisor verification
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval
Detail - Concrete Compressive Strength on 28 days to gain min of 10MPa
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Blinding concrete shall have a minimum 28 days compressive strength of 10 Mpa and comply with the requirements for prescribed mix concrete specified by NZS 3104
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - During construction
5.1.3 - Setting out of positions of the Underpass units
Detail - Setting out to follow design coordinates and levels within tolerance as specified in PS 18.5.3 by approved licensed surveyor to certify the Set-Out positions.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval
Detail - Tolerance on the placement of internal forms and moulds shall be +-5mm
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Moulds shall be rigid accurately formed and of sufficient strength and stiffness to prevent distortion under vibration.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Pre Pour inspection to check:

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Engineer shall be informed 8 hours prior to the casting of any unit, to allow the Engineer to attend the pre-casting plant to inspect before and during production of the units.
○ Reinforcing shall be pre assembled wherever possible into rigid cages using a template or jig. Reinforcing shall be tied together with wire unless otherwise accepted by the Engineer
○ Confirm correct type and location of cover block is used.
Verifying Document - Pre pour inspection checklist, Manufacturer QA records
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval
Detail - Pre cast Methodology from Pre co to submit to Engineer and Compression Test Report

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - For pours under 150m³: three standard cylinders shall be made for each 50m³ of concrete placed, or part thereof, for testing of 28 days compressive strength in an approved laboratory.

○ For repetitive precast underpass units with 6.42m3 each pours undertaken on a regular basis, three standard cylinders shall be made for each of the first five pours of any one type, and thereafter three standard cylinders shall be made for every fifth pour of that type for testing of 28 days compressive strength in an approved laboratory.
Verifying Document - Slump Test/ Compressive strength test Report at 28 days/Pre pour inspection checklist
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval
5.2.3 - Surface Finish of pre cast concrete Units
Detail - Surface finish to comply the requirements for pre cast concrete units.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - For all precast concrete units all surfaces except those against which concrete will be subsequently placed, shall have a concrete surface finish complying with the requirements of NZS 3114, F4 finish for formed surfaces and U3 finish for unformed surfaces.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Item

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Following the concrete pour and stripping out form works: the concrete shall be inspected for Size, Shape, Features, inserts, reliefs, and Finish against the drawings.
Verifying Document - Visual Inspection/ Post pour checklist
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Pour
Detail - Repair of defective concrete finish other than that due to minor porosity of the surface shall be carried out only when approved by the Engineer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Repair of defective concrete finish other than that due to minor porosity of the surface shall be carried out only when approved by the Engineer.
Verifying Document - Visual Inspection/ Post pour checklist
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - All Concrete Elements
5.3.3 - Joint Sealing of Pre cast members
Detail - Joint sealing of pre cast members

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Joints are to be sealed using a fuel resistant, multi-component polysulphide sealant designed for horizontal and vertical joints in concrete and is joint sealant pourable or gunning grade as appropriate.
Verifying Document - Post installation inspection check list
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - After placing pre-cast units
SECTION 6 – CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITY- POST TENSIONING OF UNDERPASS UNITS
6.1.1 - Detail methodology for Post Tensioning of Stage 1 of underpass units to develop and send to designer for approval
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 1*15.2 Galvanized, greased and sheathed strand per corner (Ungrouted) to be inserted in each corner for stage 1, 16 units of underpass.
○ Both ends will have a 40mm rebate for grouting.
○ And those strands will be tensioned to meet the project specification.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Before installing units
6.1.2 - Detensioning of stage1 underpass units for Stage 2 construction
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Detensioning will be done on one corner at a time, remove wedges via special pocket pull new strand and tension.
○ This will ensure at least 3 corners remain under tension at any given time.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Before landing stage 2 units

Detail - Post tensioning of strand to be done not to exceed 80% of maximum ultimate breaking strength. Post tensioning strands to be stressed simultaneously or following the sequence of stressing as noted on shop drawings.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Stressing forces shall be as per NZS 3101 section 19 for maximum permissible levels of force within a strand during and after stressing.
○ In no case shall a strand be stressed to greater than 80% of its ultimate breaking strength.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - All units for tensioning
6.1.4 - Concrete Strength at time of stressing

Detail - Samples taken during construction of concrete member to be tested for compressive strength and the results shall be used to determine the acceptability of the structural member for stressing.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The minimum compressive strength required before stressing shall be 30MPa unless noted otherwise on the drawings.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - as per test report in section 2.2.2
Detail - Calculation done will form the basis of comparison to the actual stressing results recorded as an indication that the appropriate levels of stressing are being achieved in each strand.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Theoretical calculations for each strand size and profile to determine theoretical jacking forces and corresponding theoretical elongations. These calculations shall be based on the assumed property of strand and forwarded to the Engineer for review and approval at least 7 working days prior to the stressing operations commencing.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - All units for tensioning
Detail - Post tensioning strands shall be cut flush with the end faces of the pre cast unit (including any recess) unless noted otherwise on the drawings. Gas cutting of Strand is not permitted.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Cut ends of the strand sealed and protected with minimum of 5mm of epoxy mortar or a coat of high build epoxy paint.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - All units with Strands
Detail - Record of stressing shall be taken and reported to designer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Stressing record as per PS 19.14.1 section IV, subsection I
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - All units with Strands
